description: Persistently elevated blood pressure (systolic ≥140 mmHg or diastolic ≥90 mmHg)

general: Monitor blood pressure daily; target < 140/90 mmHg
Take medications as prescribed; do not stop on your own
diet: Limit sodium intake to < 2.3g per day
Increase intake of vegetables and fruits, especially potassium-rich foods
Control total caloric intake to maintain a healthy weight
Limit alcohol: men < 2 drinks/day, women < 1 drink/day
exercise: Regular aerobic exercise: 150 minutes of moderate intensity per week
Monitor blood pressure before and after exercise
Avoid strenuous exercise; gradually increase intensity
monitoring: Monitor blood pressure daily and record trends
Regularly check kidney and heart function
lifestyle: Quit smoking and avoid secondhand smoke
Reduce stress and learn relaxation techniques
Get sufficient sleep: 7–8 hours per night

domestic: About 60% of people with hypertension in Taiwan are unaware of their condition
Hypertension prevalence is higher in Taiwanese men (28.5%) than women (21.8%)
Around 40% of hypertensive patients in Taiwan also have diabetes
About 25% of hypertensive patients in Taiwan have cardiovascular disease
ethnic: Hypertension prevalence among Asians is about 20–30%
Asians have higher salt sensitivity and respond more to sodium intake
Prevalence among African Americans is about 40–45%
African Americans tend to develop hypertension earlier and more severely
Whites tend to develop hypertension at a later age
